command: iptables -I INPUT -m recent --name t1205_mdns --rcheck --seconds 60 -p tcp --dport 53530 -j ACCEPT; iptables -I INPUT -p udp --dport 5353 -m string --string "_t1205._udp.local" --algo bm -m recent --name t1205_mdns --set -j LOG --log-prefix "T1205-mDNS-SIGNAL "; nc -l -p 53530 -k >/dev/null 2>&1 &
explanation: Detects a crafted mDNS query string (_t1205._udp.local) on UDP/5353. The firewall logs the event and temporarily allows TCP/53530 for the source, with nc listening. Emulates service-discovery-based traffic signaling.
rationale_steps: Parse mDNS query content for a covert key
Log unusual mDNS service names as detection telemetry
Open a hidden port only after the mDNS signal is observed
